result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy Ray Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billy Ray Jackson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: As to both counts:  Defendant sworn.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, elements and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.   Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.   Bail conditions to remain as set.

Defendant Billy Ray Jackson in court with attorney Chris Bailey.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  On State's motion court amended Count 1 to Criminal Damage to Property under 943.01(1) a Class A misdemeanor and charged Count 2:  Attempted Theft undert 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a) a Class A misdemeanor.  The defendant waived reading and pled not guilty.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Billy Ray Jackson in court with attorney Christopher M. Bailey.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case recalled.  Justice Point notified the court that defendant tested positive for THC.  Court admonished defendant but granted joint request to allow the substances to leave defendant's system and allow defendant to remain on monitoring.  Court again warned that any further use would result in cash bail.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.

Defendant Billy Ray Jackson in court with attorney Christopher M. Bailey.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request a date for plea and sentencing.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20.

Justice Point report received; defendant's baseline was positive; Court WARNED defendant that further positive tests would result in a change of bail.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Billy Ray Jackson in court with attorney Chris Bailey.  Randy Sitzberger for James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/16/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DEBORAH M.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Billy Ray Jackson in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Billy Ray Jackson in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
